DataElement.preferredName: Eflornithine Agent Dose Reduced Duration Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of days reduced dose of Eflornithine was administered

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount._A difluoromethylated ornithine compound with antineoplastic activity.  Eflornithine irreversibly inhibits ornithine decarboxylase, an enzyme required for polyamine biosynthesis, thereby inhibiting the formation and proliferation of tumor cells. Polyamines are involved in nucleosome oligomerization and DNA conformation, creating a chromatin environment that stimulates neoplastic transformation of cells. This agent has been shown to induce apoptosis in leiomyoma cells. (NCI04)_An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A difluoromethylated ornithine compound with antineoplastic activity.  Eflornithine irreversibly inhibits ornithine decarboxylase, an enzyme required for polyamine biosynthesis, thereby inhibiting the formation and proliferation of tumor cells. Polyamines are involved in nucleosome oligomerization and DNA conformation, creating a chromatin environment that stimulates neoplastic transformation of cells. This agent has been shown to induce apoptosis in leiomyoma cells. (NCI04):An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Concepts.definition: A difluoromethylated ornithine compound with antineoplastic activity.  Eflornithine irreversibly inhibits ornithine decarboxylase, an enzyme required for polyamine biosynthesis, thereby inhibiting the formation and proliferation of tumor cells. Polyamines are involved in nucleosome oligomerization and DNA conformation, creating a chromatin environment that stimulates neoplastic transformation of cells. This agent has been shown to induce apoptosis in leiomyoma cells. (NCI04)
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
